StructureDescriptions.noStructure: Your mech is destroyed. You may still exit it as normal.
StructureDescriptions.crushingHit: Become Stunned until the end of your next turn and roll for System Trauma.

directHit.base: 3+ STRUCTURE: Become Jammed until the end of your next turn.
directHit.one: 1 STRUCTURE: Become Stunned until the end of your next turn and roll for System Trauma.
directHit.two: 2 STRUCTURE: Make a Hull check. On success, become Jammed until the end of your next turn. On failure, become Stunned until the end of your next turn and roll for System Trauma.

StructureDescriptions.systemTrauma: Roll 1d6. On 1–3, all weapons on one mount of your choice are destroyed; on 4–6, a system of your choice is destroyed. Limited systems/weapons that are out of charges are not valid choices. If there are no valid choices, it becomes the other result. If there are still no valid choices, this result becomes DIRECT HIT instead.
StructureDescriptions.glancingBlow: Become Impaired until the end of your next turn.

StressDescriptions.noStress: You suffer a reactor meltdown at the end of your next turn. When it happens, you may choose to eject your core instead: target a space within Range 3; the core is ejected to that space, where it melts down in a Blast 2 explosion that deals 4d6 Explosive damage or half on a successful Agility save.
StressDescriptions.criticalFail: You suffer a reactor meltdown at the end of your next turn. When it happens, you may choose to eject your core instead: target a space within Range 3; the core is ejected to that space, where it melts down in a Blast 2 explosion that deals 4d6 Explosive damage or half on a successful Agility save.

meltdown.one: 1 STRESS: You suffer a reactor meltdown at the end of your next turn. When it happens, you may choose to eject your core instead: target a space within Range 3; the core is ejected to that space, where it melts down in a Blast 2 explosion that deals 4d6 Explosive damage or half on a successful Agility save.
meltdown.two: 2 STRESS: Make an Engineering check. On success, become Exposed. On failure, you suffer a reactor meltdown after 1d6 of your turns. Starting on your next turn, you may retry the Engineering check as a free action. On success, the meltdown is prevented. If the meltdown happens, you may choose to eject your core instead: target a space within Range 3; the core is ejected to that space, where it melts down in a Blast 2 explosion that deals 4d6 Explosive damage or half on a successful Agility save.

StressDescriptions.emergencyShunt: Become Impaired until the end of your next turn.
